author: The Politics Desk
description: In today’s edition, our Capitol Hill team provides a status update on the “big, beautiful bill” as Senate Republicans aim to hold a vote this week.
title: Trump ramps up pressure amid growing GOP tensions over his bill: From the Politics Desk

author: The Associated Press
description: A federal appeals court in New York on Tuesday ordered the Trump administration to facilitate the return of a man who was deported to El Salvador roughly 30 minutes after the court suspended an order to remove him from the U.S.The ruling in Jordin Alexander Melgar-Salmeron's case marks at least the fourth time this year that President Donald Trump’s administration has been ordered to facilitate the return of somebody mistakenly deported
title: Court orders Trump admin to facilitate another deported man's return from El Salvador

author: Ken Dilanian
description: The FBI is returning counterterrorism agents who were ordered to focus on immigration cases back to their old jobs due to concern about potential threats from Iran.
title: FBI returning agents to counterterrorism work after diverting them to immigration

author: Greg Rosenstein
description: Rutgers forward Ace Bailey has as much potential as any prospect in Wednesday's draft but comes with some concerns according to NBA personnel.
title: He's either an NBA star or the draft's biggest bust. Teams are trying to decide which it is.

author: Gordon Lubold
description: The initial assessment would appear to contradict Trump and Netanyahu's claims that Iran's nuclear capabilities were "obliterated" by the U.S. attack.
title: Strikes on Iran set back its nuclear program several months, sources say

description: An early Pentagon assessment found that recent U.S. strikes may have delayed Iran’s nuclear program by just three to six months, according to multiple officials. While the military operation hit its targets, the White House is pushing back on the report, calling it a low-level assessment.
title: U.S. strikes may have only briefly set back Iran’s nuclear program

author: Sahil Kapur
description: GOP leaders are hoping to vote on the legislation this week, but they still need to work through key issues across both chambers on Medicaid, clean energy and SALT.
title: Senate Republicans scramble to resolve tense divisions as Trump ramps up pressure to pass his big bill

author: The Associated Press
description: LOS ANGELES — A woman who masterminded the killing of her husband, an internationally known hairdresser and beauty company executive, at their Los Angeles home eight years ago was sentenced Monday to life in prison without the possibility of parole
title: California woman who plotted the murder of her hair-mogul husband sentenced to life

author: Kate Rogers, CNBC
description: Chris Schwegmann is getting creative with how artificial intelligence is being used in law
title: Small business AI use is lagging, but one firm is channeling Sherlock Holmes and knocking out 'grunt work'

author: Mirna Alsharif
description: Daniel Park, the Washington man who was charged with providing large amounts of chemicals used in a car bomb outside a fertility clinic in Palm Springs, California, last month, died on Tuesday while in federal custody, according to the Department of Justice
title: Daniel Park, alleged accomplice in Palm Springs fertility clinic bombing, dies in federal custody

author: Angela Yang
description: A federal judge has sided with Anthropic in a major copyright ruling, declaring that artificial intelligence developers can train on published books without authors’ consent
title: Federal judge rules copyrighted books are fair use for AI training

author: Aria Bendix
description: A week before they are due to start work at U.S. hospitals, hundreds of doctors from abroad are still waiting to obtain visas granting them temporary stays in the country
title: Hundreds of international doctors due to start medical residencies are in visa limbo

author: Abigail Williams
description: Israel hailed its offensive against Iran as a success on Tuesday as it thanked its closest ally, the United States, for its role in “eliminating” the Iranian nuclear threat.
title: Even after U.S. and Israeli strikes, Iran may still be able to build a nuclear weapon

author: Ken Dilanian
description: A top official at the Justice Department told subordinates they would need to consider ignoring court orders the day before the administration carried out deportations under the Alien Enemies Act, according to a department whistleblower
title: Whistleblower says top DOJ official suggested ignoring court orders on deportations

author: The Associated Press
description: Atlanta police said Tuesday that three men and a juvenile could face hate crimes charges after they pulled down LGBTQ pride flags and cut them up at an intersection known as the center of the city's LGBTQ community.
title: 4 could be charged with hate crimes for destroying LGBTQ pride flags, Atlanta police say

author: Ali McCadden, CNBC
description: Families are not holding back on back-to-school spending this year, despite growing economic pressure, according to a new PwC consumer survey
title: Back-to-school spending persists despite economic pressure, consumer survey says

description: Prosecutors in the Sean "Diddy" Combs sex trafficking trial rested their case after twenty-nine days of testimony. When asked by the judge, Combs said he had decided not to testify.
title: Prosecutors rest their case against Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs

author: The Associated Press
description: Bobby Sherman, a teen idol in the 1960s and ’70s with bubblegum pop hits like “Little Woman” and “Julie, Do Ya Love Me,” has died. He was 81.
title: Bobby Sherman, teen idol of the 1960s and '70s, dies at 81

author: Matt Lavietes
description: A 4-year-old boy was hospitalized on Saturday after an explosion at a children's museum outside of Oklahoma City, according to NBC affiliate KFOR
title: 4-year-old boy hospitalized after explosion at Oklahoma children's museum

description: Bodycam video captured the moment “Cobra Kai” actor Alicia Hannah-Kim confronted her co-star Martin Kove over biting her at a fan meet-and-greet in Washington. Hannah-Kim chose not to pursue charges but filed a report to "go on his record."
title: 'Cobra Kai' actor confronts co-star Martin Kove over biting her

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: Caroline Dias Goncalves, a 19-year-old college student from Utah, described her time in immigration detention following a routine traffic stop in Colorado as a 'nightmare.'
title: Dreamer who spent 15 days in ICE detention says she was 'scared and felt alone'

author: Lauren Sausser and Phil Galewitz | KFF Health News
description: Nearly seven months after the fatal shooting of an insurance CEO in New York drew widespread attention to health insurers’ practice of denying or delaying doctor-ordered care, the largest U.S. insurers agreed Monday to streamline their often cumbersome preapproval system
title: 5 takeaways from health insurers' new pledge to improve prior authorization

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: Don’t expect a long stay in Pittsburgh for newly signed quarterback Aaron Rodgers
title: Aaron Rodgers says 'I'm pretty sure this will be my last season'

description: Voting is underway for New York City's Democratic mayoral primary, as Andrew Cuomo and Zohran Mamdani lead the polls in a crowded field. NBC News' Vaughn Hillyard spoke to the candidates on and reports on how ranked-choice voting came into play for the campaigns.
title: Voting begins for New York's mayoral primary as Cuomo and Mamdani lead polls

author: Greg Rosenstein
description: The Indiana Pacers were playing for the NBA championship on Sunday night. But when star Tyrese Haliburton was carried off the floor with an Achilles injury late in the first quarter of Game 7 of the finals, the franchise’s hopes plummeted.
title: 3 NBA stars hurt their Achilles in the postseason. Is this injury becoming more common?

author: Matt Lavietes
description: Washington authorities say there is "no certain" evidence that the father accused of killing his three young daughters is alive or in the area three weeks after the girls' bodies were discovered
title: 'No certain evidence' fugitive father accused of killing his three daughters is alive, authorities say

author: Curtis Bunn
description: The grassroots progressive group The People’s Union USA, has called for an “economic blackout” of the fast food giant.
title: Group calls for boycott of McDonald's for scaling back its DEI initiatives

author: Jo Yurcaba
description: “Enigma,” a documentary coming to HBO Tuesday, explores the divergent stories of Amanda Lear and April Ashley, two icons to the transgender community.
title: HBO documentary ‘Enigma’ explores transgender identity and legacy

author: Alex Harring, CNBC
description: An ad focused on combating bullying against LGBTQ youth from the late 2000s starring Hilary Duff has become a cult classic and shown cultural staying power.
title: How a gay anti-bullying PSA from the late 2000s became a cult classic

author: Denise Chow
description: A dangerous heat wave continues to grip almost the entire eastern half of the United States, with temperatures expected to spike Tuesday and dozens of new record highs possible across a huge swath of the country
title: Extreme heat blankets U.S., with almost 160 million under alerts from Texas to Maine

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: “Cobra Kai” actor Martin Kove allegedly bit his co-star Alicia Hannah-Kim on the arm so hard he nearly drew blood, according to a police report.
title: 'Cobra Kai' actor Martin Kove accused of biting costar Alicia Hannah-Kim, nearly drawing blood

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: A fight over the fate of six migrants the Trump administration wants to deport to South Sudan flared up again as the Justice Department accused a federal judge of "unprecedented defiance" of a Supreme Court decision the previous day.
title: Trump administration accuses judge of 'unprecedented defiance' of Supreme Court in immigration dispute

author: Scott Wong
description: Garcia, 47, in just his second term, defeated a more senior lawmaker to succeed the late Rep. Gerry Connolly on the panel, which provides oversight of the Trump administration.
title: Rep. Robert Garcia elected as top Democrat on the House Oversight Committee

author: Matt Lavietes
description: Animal rescue activist and YouTube star Mikayla Raines has died by suicide, according to her husband.
title: YouTube star Mikayla Raines dies by suicide at 29, husband blames online abuse

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Two outdoor graduation ceremonies in Paterson, New Jersey, held during a dangerous heatwave ended with more than 100 people receiving treatment and some being taken to the hospital, authorities said.
title: Over 100 people fall ill at New Jersey graduations in 'mass casualty' incident due to extreme heat

author: Rob Wile
description: President Donald Trump wants interest rate cuts.
title: Fed chairman Jerome Powell testifies amid ongoing Trump attacks over interest rates

author: Megan Lebowitz
description: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump lashed out at Israel and Iran on Tuesday morning as the ceasefire deal announced hours earlier appeared on the brink of collapse.
title: Trump lashes out at Israel and Iran: 'They don't know what the f--- they're doing'

author: Patrick Smith
description: LA Clippers star player James Harden has been accused of negligence in a lawsuit that claims a woman was raped by his nephew while she was unconscious after a New Year's Eve party at his Texas house last year
title: NBA star James Harden accused of negligence in sexual assault lawsuit against his nephew

author: Matt Lavietes
description: The jury foreman in the Karen Read murder retrial said Tuesday he thought the former police officer's girlfriend was always "an innocent woman.""Karen Read is innocent and she didn't do this crime," Juror No.
title: Jury foreman in Karen Read retrial thought she was innocent from 'Day 1'

author: Mike Calia
description: Krispy Kreme originally planned to sell donuts in all of McDonald's U.S. locations by the end of 2026.
title: Short and not so sweet: McDonald's and Krispy Kreme end brief partnership

author: Reuters
description: A Mexican man who prosecutors say briefly evaded arrest with the help of a Wisconsin judge has agreed to plead guilty to illegally entering the United States
title: Mexican man allegedly aided by Wisconsin judge agrees to guilty plea

author: Astha Rajvanshi
description: Nearly 150 people were jabbed with syringes during a street music festival in France, the country’s interior ministry said, adding that authorities had arrested at least 12 suspects
title: Over a hundred people jabbed with syringes at French music festival

author: Dylan Butts, CNBC
description: China, which has triggered global shortages with its controls on rare earth exports, is itself reliant on rare earth supplies from the small, war-torn country of Myanmar.
title: How a war-torn Myanmar plays a critical role in China’s rare earth dominance

description: President Trump spoke to reporters about the accusations that Israel and Iran have violated a ceasefire agreement, adding that the two countries had been fighting so long that "they don't know what the f--- they're doing."
title: Trump on Israel and Iran: 'They don't know what the f--- they're doing'

description: Life-threatening heat is impacting more than 145 million people across the United States with triple-digit temperatures from Texas to New England. In New Jersey, a pair of outdoor graduation ceremonies landed 16 attendees in the hospital. NBC’s Emilie Ikeda reports and TODAY’s Al Roker tracks the forecast.
title: Dangerous and Scorching Heat Wave Hits Millions Across US

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: Israel and Iran agree to a precarious truce after nearly two weeks of fighting.
title: Israel and Iran ceasefire under strain and what to watch in New York City primary: Morning Rundown

author: Ariana Brockington, TODAY
description: Dermot Mulroney has filed for divorce from his wife, Prima Apollinaare, after nearly 15 years of marriage
title: Dermot Mulroney Files for Divorce From Wife Prima Apollinaare, Asks for Spousal Support

author: The Associated Press
description: STARKE, Fla. — A man convicted of raping and killing a woman near a central Florida bar is scheduled to be executed Tuesday
title: Florida set to execute man convicted of raping and killing a woman outside of a bar

author: The Associated Press
description: The National Transportation Safety Board on Tuesday will be focused on preventing another terrifying event like the one involving a panel that flew off a Boeing 737 Max midair in January of 2024
title: NTSB set to meet on door plug investigation of terrifying Alaska Airlines flight

author: Steve Kornacki
description: The final public poll suggests the potential for an upset in Tuesday’s New York Democratic mayoral primary — an outcome that would be dramatic but that also might end up resolving nothing.
title: Steve Kornacki: Breaking down the state of New York’s mayoral race on primary day

author: Noor Noman
description: Trump and MAGA Republicans are obsessed with targeting America’s tiny population of trans people. This personal account of medically transitioning while Trump takes office, during Pride 2025, shines light on the complexities of this moment.
title: What it's like to medically transition while Trump is president

author: Chantal Da Silva
description: It was 8 p.m., just after sunset, when Reem Zeidan, 42, set off for an aid distribution site with two of her eight children, Mervat, 20, and Ahmad, 12.
title: She walked for hours in hope of getting food. But Israeli forces killed her, family says

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: The Dallas Mavericks are set to take former Duke star Cooper Flagg at No. 1 overall in Wednesday's NBA Draft.
title: Why Cooper Flagg is one of the NBA's most intriguing prospects of the last 15 years

author: Erik Ortiz
description: Federal prosecutors in New York are expected to rest their case Tuesday against Sean “Diddy” Combs, while the music mogul’s defense team intends to offer no witnesses of its own, bringing the sprawling racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking trial to an end sooner than expected
title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs' defense won't call any witnesses in sex trafficking trial

author: Ben Kamisar
description: New York City heads to the polls Tuesday to cast ballots in the city’s mayoral primaries, dominated by former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo’s comeback tour and progressive state legislator Zohran Mamdani’s late rise in the Democratic contest.
title: What to watch in New York City's mayoral primary

description: In a social media post, Trump warned Israel against launching another attack, telling it to bring its pilots home.
title: Trump slams Iran and Israel amid truce violations claims

author: The Associated Press
description: A woman charged in the death of a U.S.
title: Woman with ties to a cultlike group to appear in court after border agent's killing

author: The Associated Press
description: Mick Ralphs, a guitarist, singer, songwriter and founding member of the classic British rock bands Bad Company and Mott the Hoople, has died
title: Mick Ralphs, founding member of Bad Company and Mott the Hoople, dies at 81

description: In the trial of Sean "Diddy" Combs, the prosecution team is expected to rest its case, and the defense team does not plan to call any witnesses to the stand, according to Combs' lead attorney, Marc Agnifilo. NBC News' Chloe Melas and Danny Cevallos break down the latest details in the case.
title: Sean Combs' lawyers say they do not plan to call witness after prosecution rests case

author: Natasha Korecki
description: Members of Congress have been all over the map in their reactions, while many governors — seen as potential 2028 presidential candidates — have avoided weighing in on policy.
title: Democrats struggle to come up with a unified response to Trump's Iran strikes

author: Sara G. Miller
description: Sen. Bill Cassidy, R-La., criticized Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s picks for a key federal vaccine advisory committee and called for its meeting to be delayed.
title: Kennedy’s new vaccine panel lacks experience and shouldn’t meet, Sen. Cassidy says

author: Yamiche Alcindor
description: In a phone interview with NBC News, President Donald Trump said he did not believe Israel and Iran “will ever be shooting at each other again.”
title: Trump says he expects his announced Israel-Iran ceasefire will last 'forever'
